content.description: Start on big hand and footholds. Work your way up to mantle onto a ledge. The anchors are 1-2 moves above the ledge.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor which can be accessed by scrambling down and around to the ledge from the Greenfire anchor.  The anchors are awkward to clip, so you might want to put in some pro to protect if setting up as a top-rope.  Alternatively, the route can be led on trad gear.

content.description: Begin up the short offwidth crack to a small roof.  Pull this to get to easier climbing.  Alternatively, you can move up left of the roof and traverse back over to just above the roof.  Then straight up to the anchors.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor on the large ledge.  Bolts are set back from the edge about 3 feet, so plan your anchor accordingly.
content.location: Begins 5 ft right of Take Me Home

content.description: Crux is the start.  Alternatively, can begin from start of Greenfire and traverse under roof to the crux move.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchor at the top.  Just to climber's right of Greenfire bolts and just over the edge on the face.
content.location: Starts 10 ft right and slightly uphill of Greenfire.

content.description: This wall contains 3 sets of anchors.  Two sets are on the ‘patio’ to the right of the climbers trail at the switchbacks just below the green fenced observation platform.  The anchors for ‘Beauty’ are over the edge (on the cliff face) to the left of the anchors for ‘Greenfire’ which are on the patio, about 2-3 feet back from the edge of the cliff.  The anchor for ‘Take Me Home’ is a scramble down to the next ledge to right of Greenfire.  Look left to see the anchor, a 0.5 Cam can help secure the climber as they step out to clip in the rope for TR.  To get to the bottom of the routes, take the climbers trail down to Sunset and hang a right down the hill.  Beauty is the first route to the right at the bottom, Greenfire is on the other side of the boulder, and Take Me Home is another 10 feet past Greenfire.  The cliff is generally shady, but faces southwest so it is nice on fall and winter afternoons.Note: there is a cave about 15 feet past Take Me Home where mated pair of Vultures hatch 1-3 eggs each spring... please give the family a very wide berth and NEVER touch the eggs or chicks.
